decision_conditions: Time limit condition not applicable as development has already been started | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved

ELE-01B, ELE-02B, FP-01B, FP-02B, FP-03B, FP-04B, S-01B, SL-01, SL-02A, EX-01, EX-02, EX-03, IE-01B, IE-02A, IE-03A, IE-04B, IE-05A, Energy & Sustainability Statement (Revised), Acoustic Assessment Report (May 2017), Transport Statement (May 2017), Framework Travel Plan Ref170724 - 549 - FTPv3 (July 2017), Air Quality Assessment, Historic Environment Desk Based Assessment, Economic Viability Assessment (May 2017), Urban Design Appraisal, Drainage Assessment Form, Drainage Strategy, Design and Access Statement, Planning Statement (June 2017)
And amended by drawing numbers:
DVE-WMC-02-009-A, DVE-WMC-02-010-A, DVE-WMC-02-011-A, DVE-WMC-02-012-B, DVE-WMC-02-013-A, DVE-WMC-02-014-A, DVE-WMC-02-015, DVE-WMC-02-016
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| The external materials shall be as per approved under 181402CND and 215896NMA. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved materials and be retained as such, thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012) and the London Plan (2021).
| The site demolition and construction method statement/ management plan shall be as approved under 181722CND.  The demolition and construction shall be carried out as approved in the Plans.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of local residents and to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies T4  of the London Plan (2021); the National Planning Policy Framework (2021); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| The details of hard and soft landscaping including the tree protection and tree planting proposals as submitted to and hereby approved by the local planning authority shall be laid out and planted prior to the occupation of the development.  Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained permanently.
Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021.
| Details of screening to the perimeters of the podium terrace resident's amenity area shall be as approved under permission 181723CND.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| 7A Details of the Energy Strategy (dwellings) shall be as approved  under 202391CND
7B Details of the Energy Performance Certificate shall be as approved under 214867CND.

7C. Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.
| 8A. Details of the Energy Strategy (commercial spaces) shall be as approved under 202468CND.

8B.Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial spaces, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

8C. Within three-months of the practical completion of the commercial spaces, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with the London Plan 20121, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014).
| The details of the dynamic thermal modelling shall be as approved under 202469CND

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with the London Plan 2021, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).

| Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment or heat and/or electricity imported into the site shall be installed and maintained accordingly. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with the London Plan 2021, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).
| 11A. Details of the Considerate Constructors Scheme shall be as approved under 181724CND.

11B. Prior to the first occupation of the dwellings, the approved development, including domestic and non-domestic units, shall incorporate and maintain sustainability measures in line with the Energy and Sustainability Statement (25 May 2017), prepared by Build Energy Ltd.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development accordance with the London Plan 2021, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012).
| Details of the water efficiency standards shall be as approved under 202470CND
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with the London Plan 2021.

| The on-site cycle parking facilities shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be completed and made available prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Following submission to and written approval by the local planning authority of an agreed Car Parking Management Plan, all of the car parking and the associated access and manoeuvring areas shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of any dwelling or the replacement working mens club and subsequently these areas shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for disabled drivers, in accordance with the London Plan 2021 and policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012).

| Prior to any part of the development hereby approved first being brought into use, the delivery vehicle layby shown on approved Drawing No. DVE-WMC-02-009 Rev A (Site Layout Plan) shall be laid out, constructed and surfaced to the written satisfaction of the local planning authority.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7A, & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the London Plan (2021), and The National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The refuse and recycling storage enclosures hereby approved shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to first occupation of any part of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021).
| The noise exposure category shall be as approved under 181725CND.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Insulation of the floor/ceiling between the ground floor working men's club and the dwellings above shall be installed to meet an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the ground floor plant rooms and car park.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Details of the contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site shall be as approved under 181726CND

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), The London Plan (2021), and The National Planning Policy Framework (2012),  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.
| The detailed remediation scheme shall be as approved under 181727CND

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), The London Plan (2021), The National Planning Policy Framework (2021),  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

| The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given four weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.  The scheme shall thereafter be retained as such.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), The London Plan (2021), The National Planning Policy Framework (2021),  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

| Following completion of measures identified in any approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be produced and submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), The London Plan (2021), The National Planning Policy Framework (2021),  DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.
| Details of the drainage strategy for the disposal of foul and surface water shall be as approved under 181728CND

Reason: To ensure that the development does not cause adverse local environmental impact and to accord with the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and The National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The onsite stand-alone communal heating system shall be as approved under 202471CND

Reason: To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Strategy Statement and to ensure that the energy plant room is designed in a manner which allows for the future connection to an offsite district heat network, and to ensure that the development contributes to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy (April 2012), policy LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Prior to the first occupation of any part of the development the measures set out in the Framework Travel Plan Ref170724 - 549 - FTPv3 (July 2017) shall implemented to the satisfaction of the local planning authority.

Reason: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than the use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainable transport in accordance with policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, and the London Plan 2021 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to any part of the development first being brought into use, provision and commissioning shall be made within the site of electric car charging points for two vehicles, with provision for the installation of two further charging points to meet future need.

Reason: To promote the use of energy efficient and sustainable modes of transport in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainable transport in accordance with Policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, and the London Plan 20121 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Details of the archaeological investigations and method statement shall be as approved under application 182604CND.
Reason: To safeguard the archaeological interest of the site.
| No noise or sound amplifying equipment shall be installed or operated outside of the building without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory form of development and to limit any impact upon the residential amenities of the locality.
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference 166501FUL dated 29.09.2017 as varied by 215032NMA dated 26.08.2021, 215896NMA dated 21.10.2021 and 215937NMA dated 26.10.2021 for 'Demolition of Working men's club (Use Class D2) and associated structures and erection of replacement building including working men's club, residential apartments (Use Class C3) with associated amenity space, car and cycle parking, refuse storage, smoking area and alterations to access'. Variation seeks to alter the wording to reflect the increase in residential units from 34 to 37 and to update the scheme drawings.
